articles.author: Alex Weprin
articles.title: OpenAI Promises “More Granular” Control of IP in Sora After Hollywood Characters Flood Video App - hollywoodreporter.com
articles.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said late Friday that the tech company would also explore a revenue share with rightsholders.
articles.content:
OpenAI is taking steps to walk back the flood of Hollywood intellectual property that has dominated its new AI video app Sora.
Late Friday night, OpenAI Sam Altmanposted an update to his blog explai… [+1969 chars]

articles.title: Legal experts condemn Apple bowing to White House's request to remove ICE tracking app - NPR
articles.description: It's the latest example of tech giants bowing to pressure from the Trump administration. Legal experts say the developer of the app has free speech rights that may have been violated.
articles.content:
Apple and Google on Thursday removed apps that alert people when Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents are nearby following pressure from Attorney General Pam Bondi.
Critics of the tech giants … [+3649 chars]

articles.author: Sarah Perez
articles.title: Google’s Gemini AI app could soon be getting a big makeover - TechCrunch
articles.description: The company is seemingly experimenting with a new user interface that would shift the app from having a chatbot-style look and feel to one offering a scrollable feed with suggested prompts accompanied by eye-catching photos.
articles.content: After the success of OpenAI’s video editing app Sora, now at the top of the U.S. App Store, Google may be looking to give its Gemini AI app a more visually focused revamp. The company is seemingly ex… [+1939 chars]

articles.author: Andrew Cunningham
articles.title: Apple iPhone 17 Pro review: Come for the camera, stay for the battery - Ars Technica
articles.description: If your iPhone is your main or only camera, the iPhone 17 Pro is for you.
